alert.note: Alert for Pembina; Walsh (North Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks (Northeastern North Dakota and Northwestern Minnesota)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 27 at 10:26AM CDT until further notice by NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Minnesota...North Dakota... Red River of the North at Drayton affecting Marshall, Kittson, Walsh and Pembina Counties. Red River of the North at Pembina affecting Kittson and Pembina Counties. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Minnesota...North Dakota... Buffalo River near Dilworth affecting Clay County. Red River of the North at East Grand Forks affecting Polk and Grand Forks Counties. Red River of the North at Oslo affecting Walsh, Marshall, Polk and Grand Forks Counties. Red River of the North at Fargo affecting Cass and Clay Counties. Two Rivers River near Hallock affecting Kittson County. .Flooding continues on the Red River at Fargo/Moorhead and points northward (with the exception of Halstad). Fargo/Moorhead is at or near crest today (Sunday) with Grand Forks/East Grand Forks expected to crest late Monday or early Tuesday...both in the minor flood category. Oslo will continue to see moderate flooding with minor flooding at Drayton and Pembina to begin shortly as river levels rise at these locations. All North Dakota tributaries remain below flood stage. However, the Sheyenne River at the West Fargo diversion may fluctuate a bit due to some minor ice jamming. On the Minnesota side, both the Buffalo River at Dilworth and Two Rivers river at Hallock will continue to see minor flooding for the next few days while river levels continue to recede. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Red River of the North at Drayton. * WHEN...From this evening until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 32.0 feet, MINOR FLOOD. Agricultural damage begins. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:45 AM CDT Sunday the stage was 31.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this evening and continue rising to a crest of 33.5 feet Thursday evening. - Flood stage is 32.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Safety message - Turn around, don`t drown. Don`t travel through flooded areas. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
